title: Middle East respiratory syndrome–related coronavirus
summary: Middle East respiratory syndrome–related coronavirus (MERS-CoV),[1] or EMC/2012 (HCoV-EMC/2012), is the virus that causes Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS).[2][3] It is a species of coronavirus which infects humans, bats, and camels.[4] The infecting virus is an enveloped, positive-sense, single-stranded RNA virus which enters its host cell by binding to the DPP4 receptor.[5] The species is a member of the genus Betacoronavirus and subgenus Merbecovirus.[6][4]
